name: Meander cutoffs or avulsions
functionStatement: Examines the role of bank processes and erosion in channel change. Observes patterns in sinuosity and curvature affecting habitat complexity.
descriptionMarkdown: Integrates bank geometry, rooting, surface protection, raw or failing banks, and hardening to summarize erosion risk and sediment delivery.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Compile an imagery time series to map cutoff and avulsion locations and summarize frequency over decades.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Rare or slow cutoffs consistent with long-term references.

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Occasional cutoffs but not drastically more frequent than normal.

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Multiple cutoffs over recent decades suggesting partial instability.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Frequent or large-scale avulsions or cutoffs indicating severe instability or artificial triggers.

references: NAIP and Google Earth historical imagery.
